definition: to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)

sentences.english: I shook my head reprovingly, and then she blushed and whispered.
sentences.chinese: 我不以爲然地搖搖頭，於是她臉紅了，小聲說。

sentences.english: She blushed when they criticized her for her incorrect attitude toward labour.
sentences.chinese: 當他們批評她對勞動的不正確態度時，她臉紅了。

sentences.english: She blushed when we criticized he for incorrect attitude to ward labour.
sentences.chinese: 當我們批評她對待勞動的不正確態度時，她臉紅了。

sentences.english: I get so kilig everytime Ben and Felicity get together.
sentences.chinese: 每次我看到本和費利西蒂在一起時就讓我臉紅心跳的。

sentences.english: He chuckled slightly and blushed. "Yeah, that was my girl."
sentences.chinese: 他臉紅地輕聲笑了，“是的，那是我的女兒。”

sentences.english: The gril flushed when the man spoke to her.
sentences.chinese: 當那男人同她講話時，那女孩的臉紅了。

sentences.english: They blush, avert their eyes, hunch their shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她們會臉紅，躲避目光，聳聳肩。

sentences.english: I was surprised; I looked down, flushing, of course.
sentences.chinese: 我很驚訝，只得低下了頭，理所當然地臉紅了。

sentences.english: Tess blushed a little, but still did not pause in her work.
sentences.chinese: 苔絲微微有些臉紅，但仍沒有停下手裏的活計。

sentences.english: The drums sounded and instead of following the commands, the girls simply giggled and blushed.
sentences.chinese: 戰鼓敲響了，但女孩們沒有服從命令，只是臉紅傻笑。

sentences.english: She certainly blushed when I asked her about it.
sentences.chinese: 當我問及此事時，她當然臉紅了。

sentences.english: She blushed when they called her a heroine.
sentences.chinese: 當他們叫她爲巾幗英雄時她臉紅了。

sentences.english: They had a hot discussion over the pay cut of civil servants.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲公務員減薪問題而吵得臉紅耳熱。

sentences.english: It was the first time I saw you blush.
sentences.chinese: 那是我頭一回看見你臉紅。

sentences.english: The girl flushed from modesty when the man praised her appearance.
sentences.chinese: 誇獎這姑娘長得漂亮時，她羞得臉紅了。

sentences.english: She reddened at the sound of their praises.
sentences.chinese: 聽到他們的讚揚聲，她臉紅了。

definition: to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to break off relations/to break with sb
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
